author: Michael
message:
Fantastic!! :) I'm so happy to see this getting more attention. I was plesantly surprised when I installed the first beta on my live desktop (not a VM!) and this interface came up, very clean and easy to understand.

My one and only comment is I would be happy to see some more padding in the main content area (the light gray area) at the left and right margins. To my eyes, the otherwise beautiful KDE interface seems like like the main text is pressing closely to the sides of the window/sidebar, and the text is overlong than tall. So my guess would be to add like about 30 pixels padding on each inner side of the main content area to give the main text some "visual breathing room".

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Yes, some screens definitely need more space, but I removed some padding first to ensure texts were not truncated.

replies.author: Anonymous
replies.message:
Looks nice :)

I also think that at least at the left side of the main content area there should be some more padding. Also, the sidebar should have more padding at the top, i.e. "Kubuntu [...]" shouldn't stick to the top of the window/screen (if in fullscreen mode) that much (maybe you could give it (half) as much padding at the top as it has at the left/right or something like that?).

Some strings of the German translation were truncated, too, btw.
